api.please: Please provide the following query parameters when you call this Endpoint :
api.hold: : parameter to hold the page number
api.per: : parameter to hold the number of elements per page
api.insert: To insert an object in the database, add it to the HTTP request Body on Endpoint call.
api.update: To update an object in the database, define a query for find operation and add the columns to update in the HTTP request Body on Endpoint call.
api.name: Name
api.under: Under each Http method, the Endpoint path needs to be unique.
api.returnElementNumber: Your endpoint will return an object or an array ?
api.requestElementNumber: Is your request body an object or an array ?
api.resources: Select your Markup Template and all resources to inject (CSS, Js, Images,Media...)
api.insertUpdate: Please choose the type of this Endpoint, whether it is a data insertion, an update or function execution
api.read: Please choose the type of this Endpoint, whether it is a data reading or a function execution
api.interceptor: Please choose the type of Interceptor
api.reqBody: You can define the body of the query to execute

reset.resetSuccessReset: Your password have been successfully submitted. We have sent a confirmation link to your Email that expires in 24 hours

resource-details-modal.no: No parameters attached to this resource.

help.apiPath: Set the Endpoint method (ex: GET) and the path (ex: '/users/all')
help.collection:
Select a collection from the dropdown list. 
 You can use the "Add New Collection" button to add a new collection by typing the new collection's name and approve.
help.contentTypeReq: The Content-Type entity header is used to indicate the media type of the resource in the request.
help.contentTypeRes: The Content-Type entity header is used to indicate the media type of the resource in the response.
help.resNumber: Return all the elements in the result array or only the first element.
help.reqNumber: Pass one element as a request input or an array of elements.
help.fileName:
Set the name of the request parameter to host the file to upload on API call. 
 (ex: 'fileToUpload')
help.reqType:
This Endpoint can be used to Insert or Update data. 
 You need to select one option. 
 By default, 'Insert' is selected.
help.projection: Set the fields to return for all matching objects. Only the named properties will be returned.
help.query:
You can set the Query to be executed in order to manipulate data. The query needs to respect a specific format. Every field name needs to have a parameter as value that begins with '%'.
 (ex : { "name": "%name" } and you set a new parameter '%name' in parameters section)
help.addParam:
After setting the query body, add your parameters (that start with '%') in this section. 
 (ex: {"field":"%val"}, add a parameter with these properties 
 name : val, type : String, and a default value on the need )
help.httpStatus: HTTP defines forty standard status codes that can be used to convey the results of a clientâ€™s request. You can override the status codes messages.
help.primaryRessource: Select the file of the transformation.
help.secondaryRessource: Select the static files to inject into the file of the transformation.
help.addParamEditor: You can add the necessary parameters for your endpoints and manipulate them
help.outFunction: You can add a function that acts as an output interceptor to your API, query parameters and path variables
help.inFunction: You can add a function that acts as an input interceptor to your API, you can pass inserted body to it, query parameters and path variables

swaggerModal.descOpenApi: We rely on OpenAPI Specification (formerly Swagger Specification), an API description format for REST APIs, to generate an OpenAPI file which allows you to describe your entire API.
swaggerModal.afterConfig: After configuring the microservice version by setting all the endpoints definitions, you have several options to validate, execute and share this version.
swaggerModal.inscpectorVerify: You can use this Swagger Inspector to verify that your APIs work as they should. This inspector should be used to test your Query APIs only.
swaggerModal.inspectorValidate: If your API definition contains any incoherence, the inspector will outline that error. You can execute any valid API directly from the inspector.
swaggerModal.executeWays: You can import your API definitions into Postman in two ways. you can choose to use :
swaggerModal.jsonStep2: Click on the 'Import' button in the top left corner of Postman UI.
swaggerModal.jsonStep3: You will see multiple options to import the API doc. Click on the 'Paste Raw Text'.
swaggerModal.jsonStep4: Paste the JSON format in the text area and click import.
swaggerModal.jsonStep5: You will see all your APIs as 'Postman Collection' and you can use them from the Postman.
swaggerModal.downloadStep2: Click on the 'Import' button in the top left corner of Postman UI.
swaggerModal.downloadStep3: You will see multiple options to import the API doc. Click on the 'Import File'.
swaggerModal.downloadStep4: Drag the Swagger file directly from it and select it from the file system.
swaggerModal.downloadStep5: You will see all your APIs as 'Postman Collection' and you can use them from the Postman.
swaggerModal.downloadShare: Download and share your API Definition
swaggerModal.shareTwoWays: Grizzly provides two ways to share your API definition depending on your needs :
swaggerModal.devDesc: In order to share your work with other users of Grizzly-API plateform you simply download the Swagger file dedicated for developement
swaggerModal.usersDesc: In order to share your work with final users or clients, please download the Swagger file dedicated for Production
swaggerModal.tsExport: Export Swagger Models in Typescript classes
swaggerModal.downloadTypescript: Download your Swagger Models in Typescript format
swaggerModal.exportOption: Grizzly allows you to download your Swagger models as Typescript files to easily add them in your projects.

grizzlyai.message2:
Create API/microservices like a pro?
Iâ€™m your intelligent assistant, here to guide you every step of the way on this exciting journey!
grizzlyai.message4:
How to create your API/microservice? ðŸ¾

1ï¸âƒ£ Create an API/Microservice: Start by providing a brief description of your microservice.
2ï¸âƒ£ Define your data model: Create the model that suits your needs.
3ï¸âƒ£ Create your endpoints: Define your endpoints as you see fit.
grizzlyai.message5: And there you go, your microservice is taking shape! Shall we continue together?
